perturbation.explanation: By removing section (c), the contract no longer explicitly requires the consultant to perform services in accordance with all Applicable Laws. This could create a legal risk because it removes a standard clause ensuring compliance with regulations relevant to the consulting services provided, potentially exposing Aduro to liability if the consultant violates laws during their work.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General legal principles requiring compliance with applicable laws and regulations in business practices.

perturbation.original_text: From the Effective Date and for twelve (12) months after the termination of this Agreement (the "Restricted Period"), Consultant shall not, without Aduro's prior written consent, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage any employee or contractor of Aduro or its affiliates to terminate employment with, or cease providing Services to, Aduro or its affiliates. In the event of a breach of this Paragraph 7 by Consultant, Aduro shall be entitled to entry of injunctive relief. Such injunctive remedy shall be nonexclusive and shall be in addition to any and all other remedies which may be available to it at law or in equity, including without limitation, the recovery of direct, indirect, incidental, consequential and/or punitive damages.
perturbation.changed_text: From the Effective Date and for twelve (12) months after the termination of this Agreement (the "Restricted Period"), Consultant shall not, without Aduro's prior written consent, directly or indirectly, solicit or encourage any employee or contractor of Aduro or its affiliates to terminate employment with, or cease providing Services to, Aduro or its affiliates. In the event of a breach of this Paragraph 7 by Consultant, Aduro shall be entitled to entry of injunctive relief.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'Such injunctive remedy shall be nonexclusive and shall be in addition to any and all other remedies which may be available to it at law or in equity, including without limitation, the recovery of direct, indirect, incidental, consequential and/or punitive damages.', the contract limits Aduro's remedies solely to injunctive relief. California law typically allows for a broader range of remedies in breach of contract cases. By limiting remedies, this clause could be seen as an attempt to circumvent the full extent of legal remedies available under California law, thereby increasing legal risk for Aduro if the limitation is deemed unenforceable or against public policy.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California contract law regarding remedies for breach of contract.

perturbation.original_text: 9. Material Non-Public Information. Consultant may have access to, or learn, "material non-public information" about Aduro or companies working with Aduro during the course of performing Services under this Agreement. Consultant acknowledges that it is illegal to buy or sell Aduro's stock or the stock of companies working with Aduro, on the basis of "material non-public information." It is also illegal to pass such information on to others who use it to buy or sell Aduro stock. Consultant is subject to and will comply with Aduro's Insider Trading and Trading Window Policy.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. Material Non-Public Information. Consultant may have access to, or learn, "material non-public information" about Aduro or companies working with Aduro during the course of performing Services under this Agreement. Consultant acknowledges that it is illegal to buy or sell Aduro's stock or the stock of companies working with Aduro, on the basis of "material non-public information." It is also illegal to pass such information on to others who use it to buy or sell Aduro stock.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the last sentence 'Consultant is subject to and will comply with Aduro's Insider Trading and Trading Window Policy', the contract no longer explicitly requires the consultant to adhere to Aduro's internal policies related to insider trading. This weakens Aduro's protection against potential insider trading violations by the consultant. While the consultant acknowledges the illegality of insider trading, the absence of a commitment to comply with Aduro's specific policy increases legal risk and the potential for regulatory scrutiny.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and related SEC regulations on insider trading.
